line.en: Amane puts her bag on her shoulder.
She staggers slightly under the weight.
'I'll walk you to the bus stop.'
'OK, thanks.'
She gives a smile, as crisp and sunny as the\nsummer sky, to the garage, then leaves it behind.
The garage where she spent so many years shut\naway inside.
'Ha ha... It really was the most fun summer\never.'
The next day...
The first day of the new school term.
What are we gonna do now that we don't have\nenough members?
We can't ask An-chan to help every time we want\nto do a flight, so what should we do about\ntransporting the glider?
What should I do about getting my pilot's\nlicense?
While feeling downhearted and a sense of loss now\nthat Amane had left, we discussed our plans for\nclub on the way to the school in the morning.
When it comes to continuing the activities of the\nSoaring Club, Kotori, Ageha and I are all of the\nsame opinion.
'Next, time, we'll definitely fly there. To the\npassage of clouds...'
Our dream that we were so close to, but had not\nyet achieved.
However, it was there, right at my fingertips.
With that sense of reality, the dream was no\nlonger just a dream.
Now we all had a clear goal in mind.
All three of this had clearly envisioned this in\nour minds.
That's why we don't have time to feel down.
The thing that awaited us was...
...an unbelievable spectacle.
'What... is this...?'

No entry' was written on the signboard, and on
the other side, heavy machinery had made a hole
in the wall of the garage, and had smashed in the
roof.
'No way, what's going on...?'
Kotori and Ageha are lost for words before this\nhorrific spectacle.
I stood there, stunned, and desperately tried to\nthink of what could have happened.
But there's no way I could comprehend it.
The place that until yesterday, where we would\ngather and spend time together every day, had\nsuddenly been destroyed.
'Our garage...'
My knees where shaking.
I felt like all the strength had left my body,\nand then, intense rage burned inside me...
'What the hell is this all about!!?'
As I approach the person who seems to be the\nforeman, he just looks back at me with a troubled\nlook on his face.
Of course. These people have been asked to do\nthis, they're just here to do demolition work.
But I had no other outlet for my emotions.
'Why are you doing this!?'
'I had no choice. This is what was promised from\nthe beginning.'
'Tobioka...'
Tobioka just glared at me like I was being\nunreasonable towards the workers.
Meaning, if I have any complaints, then I should\ntalk to him about it.
Oh, I'll talk to him about it, alright.
'What is this all about...?'
'I've told you before. After the summer holiday\nis over, the Soaring Club is over. This place was\nplanned to be demolished.'
'Even though we're still here!?'
'You don't have enough members to be recognized\nas a club. We have tolerated you until now, but\nwill not allow it any longer.'
'That's a form of oppression! It was accepted\nthat we have the freedom to carry out our club's\nactivities!'
'If you want to carry out your activities, feel\nfree. But it will be as a society.'
'Tobioka... you son of a...!!'
'Aoi!'
Without thinking, I was about to go nuts, but\nAgeha stopped me at the last moment.
'Aoi... you mustn't.'
She shakes her head in frustration.
'Hmph. Don't get in the way of their work.\nBesides, you're already too late.'
With those his parting words, Tobioka turns to\nleave.
We stare dumbfounded at the demolition works.
Like he said, we were already too late.
'I finally found something that I want to do, and\nnow...'
'...I've never had anything like this before.'
'...Yeah.'
Ageha hardly says anything as she quietly watches\nthe demolition.
As for me...
'Hey, Aoi!'
I climbed over the 'No entry' fence and walked\ninto the garage.
'Hey you! Whadya doin'? This place is dangerous!'
The foreman from before hurriedly rushes over.
'Sorry, this won't take long.'
I say as I push past him.
Then I step inside the half-destroyed garage.
Panicking, the foreman stops the machinery.
The inside of the garage was also badly crushed,\nsmashed to smithereens along with all our\nmemories.
Emotionless, I rummage through it, and pick out\nthe things I was looking for.
'Sorry about that. It's OK now.'
I lower my head in a bow of apology to the\nworkers, and step outside the 'No entry' boards.
'Let's go.'
'Aoi.'
'Is that...?'
'...These are the designs that Amane drew. She\nsaid that she had completed them yesterday.'
'Amane's designs...'
Then there was the photo frame from Amane's desk.
Inside it was the photo that had stirred us all\ninto action.
'It's not over yet.'
I smiled at them, with empty bravado, with a\nsmile as bright as the mid-summer sun.
'I can't let it end like this. We will definitely\nfly, in our glider!'
Kotori, looking like she was going to cry, smiled\nat me.
'Yeah!'
Ageha, who had a defeated expression on her face,\nsmiled once again.
'Alright!'
A giant thunderhead was floating in the clear\nblue sky.
It is said that such clouds often go beyond the\nstratosphere.
Which means that the upward drafts go all the way\nup there.
Our dream isn't over yet.
This is the beginning.
